author: mdhildreth
body: For muon systems, the Adjuster function is modified so that all out-of-time hits are "wrapped" so that their times stay within the same bunch crossing.  This ensures that one can simulate long-lived neutrons, as long as one makes the assumptions that (a) the neutron direction and location is random and (b) that the probability that every neutron that interacts in the detector will be observed is 1.0.
title: Add automatic time wrap for muon systems to simulate long-lived neutrons
